intro: Phyteuma austriacum var. vestitum, commonly known as the Austrian beardtongue, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue to purple in color. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered with a fine, hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and rocky habitats.
